channel.title: Comments on: Hasbara as kiruv
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Eric
item.dc:creator: Eric
item.description: Kiruv for who? I suspect that "teaching arguments with which you can convince others" is partly a cover for "teaching arguments with which you can convince yourself". Thus it should include any potential future threats to the student's identity.
item.content:encoded: Kiruv for who? I suspect that “teaching arguments with which you can convince others” is partly a cover for “teaching arguments with which you can convince yourself”. Thus it should include any potential future threats to the student’s identity.

item.title: By: Shmuel
item.dc:creator: Shmuel
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://kavvanah.wordpress.com/2011/06/22/hasbara-as-kiruv/#comment-3250">Jon</a>.
I didn't go to torat shraga, but another popular post modox highschool yeshiva. I don't think the website had any shiur (besides Gemara) that was actually taught.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jon.

I didn’t go to torat shraga, but another popular post modox highschool yeshiva.
I don’t think the website had any shiur (besides Gemara) that was actually taught.

item.title: By: Jon
item.dc:creator: Jon
item.description: You're giving way too much credit for whoever writes the blurbs for Torat Shraga's website. That's my guess.
item.content:encoded: You’re giving way too much credit for whoever writes the blurbs for Torat Shraga’s website. That’s my guess.
